intro: Psychotria orosiana, commonly known as the "Coca plant" or "Yareta," is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, white to pink flowers and has elliptical, leathery leaves that are often covered in a fine, white coating. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Psychotria orosiana is also known for its use in traditional medicine and its role in the production of coca leaves.
